article.headline: Boston College 88, Duquesne 70
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Craig Smith scored 30 points and grabbed 14 rebounds, both season highs, leading Boston College to an 88-70 win over Duquesne on Wednesday afternoon. Sean Marshall scored 20 points and added seven rebounds as Boston College (9-0) matched its best start since opening the 2000-01 season with 11 wins. Jared Dudley added 13 points. The Eagles, who outrebounded the Dukes 52-24, grabbed 21 of the game's first 23 rebounds. DaVario Hudson led the Dukes (2-9) with 17 points. The Eagles, who never trailed, jumped to a 29-10 lead on Marshall's 3-pointer 14:18 into the first half. They led 45-20 at halftime. Smith outscored Duquesne by himself for most of the first half, scoring 20 points and grabbing 10 rebounds in 16 minutes of playing time. In the second half, BC never led by fewer than 16 points, opening a 27-point lead twice midway into the half. The Eagles also won their first nine games to open the 2001-02 season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
